item.title: George H. Smith has passed away
item.description:
Klaus Schmidt on Twitter

“It appears that George H. Smith passed away. In my opinion, George was the most well read scholar on capitalism, libertarianism, and anarchism. He spent hours reading a day and was passionate about both liberty and truth—his prose unmatched. 1/6 https://t.co/4CWRjSEW9d”

URL: https://twitter.com/KlausJSchmidt/status/1524584665243217921

item.title: Dan Rose
item.description:
Dan Rose on Twitter

“I was at Amzn early ’00s when we lost 95% of our market cap. Later at FB I negotiated a down-round in ‘09, and then in ’12 our stock dropped 50% post-IPO. I was on the board of a public company that went bankrupt (Borders) and a start-up that went under (Hello). Some lessons:”

URL: https://twitter.com/DanRose999/status/1522002704121225216

source: Best of Twitter - Week of May 2, 2022

item.title: Gabriel
item.description:
Gabriel on Twitter

“obviously small as an overall % of the economy, but if you work at a company where employees are compensated in stock ur kinda already at a worker-owned co-op? every weeb furry security engineer in the world is living marx’s dream rn (and god bless them)”

URL: https://twitter.com/gbrl_dick/status/1520201985399484416

source: Best of Twitter - Week of May 2, 2022

ex nihilo 🎱🦑 on Twitter

source: Best of Twitter - Week of May 2, 2022

item.title: Trenton Bricken
item.description:
Trenton Bricken on Twitter

““The cortex (GM + WM, everything outside the striatum) has ~15 B neurons and ~60 B glia; that’s ~80% of the brain’s mass and ~20% of the brain’s neurons. The cerebellum has ~70 B neurons and ~15 B glia; that’s ~10% of the mass and ~80% of the neurons.“ https://t.co/Yz9usvRrTb”

URL: https://twitter.com/TrentonBricken/status/1520032646428082176

source: Best of Twitter - Week of May 2, 2022

item.title: Trenton Bricken
item.description:
Trenton Bricken on Twitter

“Only ~500k neurons in the brain produce dopamine. Serotonin is produced by ~100k neurons in the brainstem. Serotonergic neurons project so widely that virtually every neuron in the brain may be contacted by a serotonergic fiber.”

URL: https://twitter.com/TrentonBricken/status/1520033416980402177

source: Best of Twitter - Week of May 2, 2022

item.title: Marc Andreessen
item.description:

item.title: nathanculley.eth
item.description:
nathanculley.eth on Twitter

“I’ve been a first responder for ~6 years, most spent riding an ambulance. I figured going into it that I’d have some unique takeaways from the experience, but I didn’t anticipate this understanding of how hard life can be for the less intelligent. https://t.co/2KFPfjgDBW”

URL: https://twitter.com/_NathanCulley_/status/1521927810809569281

source: Best of Twitter - Week of May 2, 2022

item.title: Marc Andreessen
item.description:
Marc Andreessen on Twitter

URL: https://twitter.com/pmarca/status/1519441880852828161

source: Best of Twitter - Week of May 2, 2022

item.title: Emmett Shear
item.description:
Emmett Shear on Twitter

“@paulg @SamoBurja If Twitter is like email, then no successor is coming. We are still stuck w email decades later. If Twitter is like Facebook, then yes. Instagram; TikTok; there will be another. So which is Twitter? Hard to say, but managed right I think good chance it’s a protocol.”

URL: https://twitter.com/eshear/status/1519514960807747584

source: Best of Twitter - Week of May 2, 2022

item.title: Kamil Galeev
item.description:
Kamil Galeev on Twitter

“Ergo. Economic processes aren’t neutral power-wise. That’s a major factor of evolution of power structures. That would also explain why many in power would sabotage economic development. If it’s too complex for them to administer, it will change power balance not in their favour”

URL: https://twitter.com/kamilkazani/status/1501385899820691459

source: Best of Twitter - Week of May 2, 2022
